Returns: a copy with a new character that represents zero, not null
withZeroDigit(char).Description: Returns a copy of the info with a new character that represents zero. The character used to represent digits may vary by culture. This method specifies the zero character to use, which implies the characters for one to nine.

ofDefaultLocale().Description: Obtains the DecimalStyle for the default @B_java#util#Locale#Category#FORMAT_E@ locale. This method provides access to locale sensitive decimal style symbols. This is equivalent to calling @B_java#time#format#DecimalStyle#of_E@.

Returns: a copy with a new character that represents the decimal point, not null
Parameters: char: the character for the decimal point
withDecimalSeparator(char).Description: Returns a copy of the info with a new character that represents the decimal point. The character used to represent a decimal point may vary by culture. This method specifies the character to use.

Returns: the character for the decimal point
getDecimalSeparator().Description: Gets the character that represents the decimal point. The character used to represent a decimal point may vary by culture. This method specifies the character to use.

of(java.util.Locale).Description: Obtains the DecimalStyle for the specified locale. This method provides access to locale sensitive decimal style symbols.

getZeroDigit().Description: Gets the character that represents zero. The character used to represent digits may vary by culture. This method specifies the zero character to use, which implies the characters for one to nine.

toString().Description: Returns a string describing this DecimalStyle.

Returns: a copy with a new character that represents the negative sign, not null
Parameters: char: the character for the negative sign
withNegativeSign(char).Description: Returns a copy of the info with a new character that represents the negative sign. The character used to represent a negative number may vary by culture. This method specifies the character to use.

Returns: a copy with a new character that represents the positive sign, not null
Parameters: char: the character for the positive sign
withPositiveSign(char).Description: Returns a copy of the info with a new character that represents the positive sign. The character used to represent a positive number may vary by culture. This method specifies the character to use.

Returns: the character for the negative sign
getNegativeSign().Description: Gets the character that represents the negative sign. The character used to represent a negative number may vary by culture. This method specifies the character to use.

Returns: true if this is equal to the other date
Parameters: Object: the object to check, null returns false
equals(java.lang.Object).Description: Checks if this DecimalStyle is equal to another DecimalStyle.

Returns: the character for the positive sign
getPositiveSign().Description: Gets the character that represents the positive sign. The character used to represent a positive number may vary by culture. This method specifies the character to use.

Returns: a Set of Locales for which localization is supported
getAvailableLocales().Description: Lists all the locales that are supported. The locale 'en_US' will always be present.

hashCode().Description: A hash code for this DecimalStyle.

ClassDesc: Localized decimal style used in date and time formatting. A significant part of dealing with dates and times is the localization. This class acts as a central point for accessing the information.
